question: In a triangle, if one angle measures 90° and another angle measures 45°, what is the measure of the third angle x?
If two angles of a triangle are 45° and 55°, what is the third angle x?
In a triangle, if one angle is 60° and another angle is 40°, what is the measure of the third angle?
In a right-angled triangle, if one of the non-right angles is 35°, what is the measure of the other non-right angle?
In any triangle, which statement is true about the sides?
options: The length of one side is less than the sum of the other two sides.
The length of one side is equal to the sum of the other two sides.
The length of one side is greater than the sum of the other two sides.
The length of one side is less than the difference of the other two sides.
